pullRequest.title: Mariadb JDBC plugin
pullRequest.bodyText:
Please answer these questions before submitting pull request


Why submit this pull request?


 Bug fix


 New feature provided


 Improve performance


Related issues
#3907



New feature or improvement

A JDBC driver plugin implemented for Mariadb. As Mariadb is based on the Mysql project, there are similarities between two drivers.
Mariadb uses the Mysql url format so I re-used the MysqlURLParser with a small modification.
PreparedStatement parameter string building logic is exactly the same between Mysql, PostgreSql and Mariadb. I created a parameter builder class to re-use between these plugins. That's why I touched a little bit to Postgresql and Mysql plugins and I checked the unit tests and scenarios to be sure to not break anything.
The latest minor versions of the the driver(2.x) are included in the test scenario.

commit.message: Add Mariadb JDBC plugin and provide tests

nodes.bodyText:
I think you need a logo PR at the rocketbot UI repo.
One question, does Mariadb or Mariadb-JDBC make more sense? if Mariadb-JDBC, then should add mapping to Component-Server-Mappings:
I think in Java, this should be Mariadb-jdbc or something indicating we instrumenting the client driver only.
Please move these two just below the existing database config. Let's keep the database config in a same place
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -125,6 +125,8 @@ property key | Description | Default |
 `plugin.http.http_params_length_threshold`| When `COLLECT_HTTP_PARAMS` is enabled, how many characters to keep and send to the OAP backend, use negative values to keep and send the complete parameters, NB. this config item is added for the sake of performance.  | `1024` |
 `correlation.element_max_number`|Max element count of the correlation context.|`3`|
 `correlation.value_max_length`|Max value length of correlation context element.|`128`|
+`plugin.mariadb.trace_sql_parameters`|If set to true, the parameters of the sql (typically `java.sql.PreparedStatement`) would be collected.|`false`|
+`plugin.mariadb.sql_parameters_max_length`|If set to positive number, the `db.sql.parameters` would be truncated to this length, otherwise it would be completely saved, which may cause performance problem.|`512`|
